ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Brett Appel and Tomek
Brett and Helen
multiple
Helen Brown
Helen Brown

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The field trip to Long Island City was ridiculous. We walked around for like 5 minutes. I can't believe I took the train 4 hours to walk around for 5 minutes.The readings were too similar to the lectures.

9) The field trip to Long Island City was a complete waste of time. We literally walked up and down the street for 10 minutes without a single word of wisdom from the TA. It would have been cheaper and more time-efficient to look at Google Maps, in lieu of making the trip.
There was a field trip to LIC. It was not organized very well and little interesting information was provided related to urban planning.
the "game." The application really helped me understand the curriculum.
Having visitors come in and talk to us during the games.
The instructor has an incredible wealth of knowledge. His intentions are virtuous.
The lectures were well prepared and interesting.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Some of the assignments were unclear.

The actual deliverables (assignments) were presented in utter ambiguity. The instructor's expectations were entirely unclear, which led to an entire class doing the assignments "wrong". The slew of TA's did nothing to offer clarity, even when approached. The instructor literally send us a follow-up memo saying that everyone in the class did the assignment wrong. Perhaps he should re-think the way he presents assignments.
Incorporation of non-architecture students into the assignments. They were so drawing/technically specific that there was little forestry students could do to really contribute.
Explanations of assignments were poor and TA's did not get back to students assignment questions until last minute.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: good
The TAs made themselves available but some of their responses to our requests to clarify the assignments were also unclear-- maybe because the assignments were unclear to them, too.
The TA's were incredibly unreliable, even via e-mail. Days would go by without responses. I even had to forward questions/comments multiple times to elicit a response.
The instructor and TA had office hours that were helpful to understand assignments.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I am an FES MEM student, and I am interested in studying urban issues.
In theory, this course is very relevant to my line of study. And, in fact, I did learn a lot but not as a result of the assignments/projects.
I am interested in urban planning policy.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: see answer to question 15
To get an introduction to how cities are built and planned.
Because I wanted to take a course with Prof. Garvin and wanted to get hands on understanding of urban planning and real estate.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
Yes
Yes, for the most part.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Yes
Yes, for the most part.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: As a non-architecture student, it was very interesting and helpful to work with two arch students.
Working with the architects on the group projects was really frustrating because they didn't start any of the projects until midnight the night before the projects were due.
I'm a non-architecture student. It seems that the architecture students in this course have a lot less invested. They were unreliable and apathetic in terms of the group projects.

It was difficult to start on assignments early because architecture students tend to wait until the last minute, although my group was supportive of trying to give me something to do early enough so I felt like I was contributing.
The main disadvantage was many group members often waited to the last minute to organize project meetings, which was frustrating.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Make sure youdon't wait until the last minute to prepare for the "game."
Sit down with the instructor one-on-one in the very beginning and ask him to concisely describe his expectations for the course. Don't bother with the TA's.
Take it if you're interested in the construction of cities and understanding what it's really like to construct a building and how regional plans might or might not affect each building.
Do not wait until the last minute to work on games.
